secure_storage.title: Secure Storage Demo
secure_storage.description: Explore encrypted storage capabilities and key management

encryption_details.title: Encryption Details
encryption_details.intro: The secure storage system uses industry-standard encryption:
encryption_details.aes: AES-256-GCM encryption for data at rest
encryption_details.pbkdf2: PBKDF2 key derivation with configurable iterations
encryption_details.salt: Unique salt and IV for each encrypted value
encryption_details.keychain: Secure key storage using OS keychain (keytar)

best_practices.title: Key Management Best Practices
best_practices.no_plain: Never store encryption keys in plain text
best_practices.rotation: Implement key rotation for sensitive data
best_practices.separation: Use separate keys for different data types

demo.unavailable: Encrypted storage is not available on this platform
demo.description: This demo shows how to securely store sensitive data like API keys, tokens, and credentials using OS-level encryption.
demo.note_encryption: Data is encrypted using OS-level encryption (Keychain/DPAPI/libsecret)
demo.note_management: Encryption keys are managed by the operating system
demo.note_logs: Values are never logged or exposed in production
demo.note_use_cases: Use for: API keys, auth tokens, credentials, secrets
demo.note_limitations: Don't use for: Large files, frequently accessed data, non-sensitive data

messages.enter_both: Please enter both key and value
messages.avail_warning: Encrypted storage is not available on this platform

home.drop_desc: Drag and drop files here to import data or open projects.

about.title: About
about.subtitle: Application and system information
about.template_desc: A secure, scalable, and modern boilerplate template for desktop applications

features.title: Features
features.context: Context isolation and Node.js integration disabled

license.title: License
license.text: This template is open source and available under the ISC License.

quick.title: Quick Test
quick.description: Run quick tests with simple input

api.title: API Test
api.hint: Use the IPC Demo page for comprehensive API testing

component_test.title: Component Playground
component_test.description: Test area for UI components and interactions.

buttons.title: Button Variants
buttons.description: Test different button styles and states

cards.simple_desc: Basic card with header and content
cards.simple_content: This is the content within the card body.
cards.muted_content: Content on a muted background surface.

notifications_demo.title: Native Notifications
notifications_demo.instruction_1: Try the quick notification buttons for common use cases
notifications_demo.instruction_2: Create custom notifications with title, body, and options
notifications_demo.instruction_3: Click on notifications to see click events logged
notifications_demo.instruction_4: Enable "With Actions" to add buttons (platform support varies)
notifications_demo.instruction_5: Watch the event log for all notification interactions
notifications_demo.instruction_6: Rate limiting prevents more than 10 notifications per minute
notifications_demo.macos_support: macOS: Full support including actions and replies
notifications_demo.windows_support: Windows 10+: Supports actions via Action Center
notifications_demo.linux_support: Linux: Support varies by desktop environment

available.title: Update Available
available.message: Version {{version}} is available. Would you like to download it now?

ready.title: Update Ready to Install
ready.message: Version {{version}} has been downloaded and is ready to install. The application will restart.
